title: 10 Famous Quotes Translated To Inspire The Springboks
text:
Facing the New Zealand National Rugby Team (coll. “All-Blacks”) is always going to be a daunting prospect, not to mention as opponents in a RWC semi-final! If we can keep the like of Lambie from soiling himself and the other youngsters from bursting out crying during the Haka. We will definitely have a foot in the door. I have decided I am not befit to inspire the Boks in this conquest. This, as I myself has realised no one can inspire me to lay body online against the likes of Jerome Kaino and Ma’a Nonu. Instead here’s some Quote: s used to by famous people much smarter than me throughout history to rally whoever they were trying to rally neatly translated to fit the Bok’s context.
1. “If your going through hell, keep going.” - Winston Churchill
When tackled by Sonny Bill Williams, get up and keep going.
2. “If you can dream it, you can do it.” - Walt Disney
If you can kick it, you can catch, pass etc. it (i.e. the rugby ball).
3. “Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.” - Thomas Jefferson
Do you know your number? It’s 10! Drop into the pocket and drop-kick that ball through for three, this will define you (ask Joel Stransky).
4. “Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.” - John F. Kennedy
Tries do not just happen. They are made to happen (through forcing down several phases and getting go-forward ball to your backline).
5 . “ There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.” - Nelson Mandela
Self-explanatory.
6. “Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.” - Og Mandino
Julian Savia will never outrun me if my determination to tackle him is strong enough.
7. “The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.” - Author Unknown
The loss to Japan cannot be changed. The All-Blacks are yet in your power to defeat.
8. “After a storm comes a calm” - Matthew Henry
After you have tackled the All-Blacks back enough times, the almost always become calm.
9. “One finds limits by pushing them” - Herbert Simon
One finds (and defeats) Owen Franks by pushing (scrummaging) him.
10. “The most effective way to do it, is to do it” - Amelia Earhaeart
The most effective way to beat the All-Blacks, is to beat the All-Blacks.
